description.narrative: 1.1 The extent to which the Law on Social Assistance (i) is based on rights and life cycle approach, and (ii) has implementation guidelines that clearly define institutional functions/roles. Scaling from 0-3, where: 0: right-based and life cycle approach are not included in the draft law on Social Assistance and no clear institutional functions/roles in implementation guidelines; 1: right-based and life cycle approach and clear institutional roles for implementation are included in the proposal submitted to the drafting team; 2: right-based and life cycle approach and clear institutional roles for implementation are submitted by the drafting team for further discussion; and 3: right-based and life cycle approach and clear institutional roles are included in the Law on Social Assistance and implementation guidelines 1.2 Number of new policies/schemes designed/adjusted and approved in line with the MPSAR 2.1 Percentage of new policies and schemes that are put in implementation. 2.2 Availability of an M&E system for SA policy/ scheme implementation. Scaling from 0-2, where: 0: M&E system for SA policy/scheme implementation is not available, 1: M&E system for SA policy/scheme implementation is prepared and shared for consultations, 2: M&E system for SA policy/scheme implementation is approved and implemented. 2.3 Number of M&E/oversight reports.

comment.narrative: 1.1 Rating: 0. Non-existence of the law on Social Assistance (SA). Right-based and life-cycle approach is not mentioned in SA law and guiding documents. No clear institutional functions/roles in implementation guidelines for SA law. 1.2 Rating: 0. MPSAR with defined SA policy improvements (in terms of coverage, level of benefit and targeting approach) approved by the GOVN in April 2017. However, there is no appropriate SA policies/schemes developed and approved accordingly. 2.1 Rating: 0. No appropriate policies schemes are implemented. 2.2 Rating: 0. Non-existence of M&E system for Social Assistance. 2.3 Rating: 0. Evaluation and oversights are on ad hoc basis. No M&E/oversight reports based on the “to be developed” M&E system.
